medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain began one day prior to admission, initially generalized but then localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). The pain was associated with nausea and subjective fever, with no vomiting. Pain intensity was increasing and localizing to the RLQ. No dysuria, constipation, or diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Crohn's disease, well controlled on Pentasa. Past surgical history: None.
